Books Bicycles =
Tell Me More

About

Making our city a better place, one street and one book at a time.

Promote Literacy

We select books by a range of authors—including kids’ books—to promote literacy in the city.

Infrastructure Awareness

By bringing together a critical mass of diverse cyclists (including families), we show politicians that Torontonians want to get out and ride but are held back by a lack of cycling infrastructure and connected, safe routes.

Moving for Change

We love our city, and our book ride has the ability to connect neighbourhoods, readers, and changemakers, resulting in concrete, lasting improvements for Toronto: promoting complete streets, supporting local businesses, and highlighting literacy.

Book Rides

All the rides that have already happened, and all the rides that are in the works!

Our Amazing Team

The volunteers that make The Reading Line a reality.

Janet Joy Wilson

Lead Organizer

Amanda Lewis

Lead Marketer

Robertson McClure

Lead Developer

Thank you Cassie Mackenzie for designing our logo, invitations and posters. Your patience and skills are priceless!

Thank you Michael James for creating our original website.

The images on this site would not be possible without the steady hands of: Jun Nogami, Robertson McClure, Pamela Gough and Janet Joy Wilson.

We are so lucky to have people volunteer not only their time but creative ideas, energy and support. Thank you everyone!!
